Description.val:
The Advanced Tactical Data Link Systems (ATDLS) funds the Time Division Multiple Access family of Link 16 terminals including the Multifunctional Information Distribution System - Low Volume Terminal (MIDS-LVT), Multifunctional Information Distribution System - Joint Tactical Radio System (MIDS_JTRS), Joint Tactical Information Distribution System (JTIDS) and the Tactical Digital Information Link - Joint (TADIL-J) message standard databases resident in the Command & Control Processor (C2P)/ Common Data Link Management System (CDLMS).  ATDLS also funds the Command and Control Processor (C2P) Technology Refresh (TR), Next Generation (NG) C2P (NGC2P) upgrades to meet LHD combat system upgrades, Link-22 capability upgrades, Link 16 terminal upgrades and replacements, Link 16 antenna replacements, Link 16 MOS Terminal Controller Central Processing replacements, Link Monitoring Management Tool (LMMT), and other ATDLS integration.

Command and Control Processor (C2P) Terminal Technology Refresh Full Systems Ship/Shore (DR003): C2P computer processing boards are obsolete and have antiquated software code with no industrial base support. Technology Refresh is required to address system hardware obsolescence in order to maintain the C2P system operational availability requirement.

Link 16 Terminal Ship/Shore (DR012): All US Navy ships with legacy Multifunctional Information Distribution System on Ship (MOS) and Joint Tactical Information Distribution System (JTIDS) terminals will have Link 16 terminals replaced with modernized MOS (MOS Mod) terminals to address Crypto Modernization (CM) and Frequency Remapping (FR) mandates and enable the implementation of future enhancements incorporated into the MIDS Joint Tactical Radio System (MIDS-J) terminals. For those ships whose legacy JTIDS or MOS system will not be replaced with MOS Mod by FY2025 will have CM/FR product improvement kits installed into the terminal to meet the FR requirement. The overall product improvement effort will bring the Link 16 terminals in compliance with the Department of Defense / Department of Transportation Memorandum of Agreement (31DEC02) and updated National Security Agency approved cryptographic algorithms.

Link 16 Antenna Replacement (DR012): Existing obsolete dedicated Link 16 shipboard antenna will be replaced.

Link Monitoring Management Tool (LMMT) Ship/Shore (DR014): LMMT is required to enable Joint Interface Control Officers (JICOs) to effectively monitor and manage the performance of tactical data link networks. Funds procurement and installation of LMMT hardware on ships and shore sites. MIDS will also be procured and installed for CVNs.

Advanced Tactical Data Link Systems (ATDLS) Training (DR666): Develop end-to-end ATDLS operator training curriculum and simulator to support new capabilities.

Justification.val:
FY2020 to FY2021 increase of $51.082 million is due to the following:

- Increase of $35.999 million due to the acceleration of Link 16 Crypto Modernization (CM) fielding across all US Navy ships in compliance with National Security Agency (NSA) milestone of CY2022. Increase provides for procurement of 70 additional systems above FY2021 quantities requested during FY 2020 President's Budget request.  Ships not upgraded with the CM capability by the NSA mandated date will lose Link-16 capability.

- Increase of $2.6 million to support end-to-end training required to update existing training manuals and simulators. The annual operator throughput for the Tactical Data Coordinator course is over 360 students. Each program of record (Link 16, C2P and LMMT) is developing new capabilities. These training dollars are required to develop an integrated training product that will coincide with initial fielding of new capabilities starting in FY23.

- Remaining $12.483 million increase due to additional Link-16 installation costs and C2P Terminal Ship support costs in FY2021.
 
Advanced Tactical Data Link Systems (ATDLS) procure command and control equipment for both shipboard and shore units including Link 16 Network Program Crypto Modernization (CM) and Frequency Remapping (FR) Upgraded Terminals, Link 16 Network Program Antennas, Command and Control Processor (C2P) hardware and software, and Link Monitoring Management Tool (LMMT) hardware and software to address Air Defense System Integrator (ADSI) obsolesce issues.

Remarks.val:
BLI 2614 procures data link components (e.g. circuit cards, routers, antennas, shock mounts, etc.) to replace obsolete ones. There is integration and testing of these components lasting 6-9 months, which causes procurements to be installed in the following fiscal year.

Unit cost and installation cost varies by ship/site due to different configurations required for both shore and ship systems.

Name.val: Adv Tact Data Link Sys (ATDLS) - DR003 C2P

Name.@footnote: The FY20 ATDLS budget has consolidated many procurement and installation lines into single procurement or installation line management by ship and shore. "C2P Terminal Shore" replaces the name "C2P Technology Refresh Full System Shore".

Name.val: Adv Tact Data Link Sys (ATDLS) - DR012 LINK 16

Name.@footnote: "Link 16 Terminal Shore" consolidates "Link 16 JTIDS Shore, Link 16 MOS Shore, Link 16 MOS MOD Shore".
"Link 16 Antenna" consolidates "Link 16 ESB-4 Antennas" and "Link 16 Upgrade Antenna".

Name.val: Adv Tact Data Link Sys (ATDLS) - DR014 LINK MONITORING MANAGEMENT TOOL (LMMT)

Name.@footnote: "LMMT Ship" consolidates "LMMT Ship (CVN)" and "LMMT Ship (L Class)".
"C2P Terminal Shore" replaces the name "C2P Technology Refresh Full System Shore".
"Link 16 Terminal Shore" consolidates "Link 16 JTIDS Shore, Link 16 MOS Shore, Link 16 MOS MOD Shore".
"Link 16 Antenna" consolidates "Link 16 ESB-4 Antennas" and "Link 16 Upgrade Antenna".
"Production Support" and "DSA" consolidated into a single ship/shore line by product.
"LMMT Ship" consolidates "LMMT Ship (CVN)" and "LMMT Ship (L Class)".

ATDLS Training (DR666): Currently, each program of record (Link 16, C2P and LMMT) are developing new capability.  These training dollars are required to develop an integrated end-to-end training product for all tactical data link (TDL) functionality including the simulation of TDL functions performed by other Programs of Record (shipboard combat systems, external communications, and shipboard networking components).   Total ADTLS End-to-End training curriculum and simulator costs align with a multi-year development schedule. This is required to complete training manuals, simulation interconnectivity, and field a simulator required for end-to-end operator training to include: C2P, LMMT, Link 16 family of systems, and other POR that provide TDL functionality.  Completion of the training materials coincides with initial fielding of these new capabilities and is required in order to conduct end user operator training once systems are operational starting in FY23.
"Production Support" and "DSA" consolidated into a single ship/shore line by product.
Increase in Link 16 Terminal Ship/Shore production support is due to MOS MOD test equipment as required in the first year of the MOS MOD production contract.
Name.val: 2.2) Link 16 Terminal Ship / Shore Production Support
2.4) C2P Terminal Ship / Shore Production Support

Name.@footnote: The FY20 ATDLS budget has consolidated many procurement and installation lines into single line management by ship and shore.  "Link 16 Terminal Ship" consolidates all lines from called "Link 16 JTIDS Ship, Link 16 MOS ship, Link 16 MOS MOD ship, Link 16 MOS terminal controllers (TC)."  The average unit cost fluctuation is primarily attributed to variance in system configuration requirements for each Link 16 platform type.

"C2P Terminal Ship" consolidates "C2P Technology Refresh Full System Ship" and "C2P LHD Upgrades". The average procurement and installation unit cost fluctuation is primarily attributed to variance in system configuration requirements for each Link 16 platform type.

Description.val:
Command and Control Processor (C2P) Technology Refresh Full Systems Ship: C2P computer processing boards are obsolete and have antiquated software code with no industrial base support.  Technology refresh is required for C2P software modernization.  Additionally, C2P configuration is not shock qualified. Full Systems upgrades are required to achieve 901D shock certification.

"Unit cost and installation cost varies by ship/site due to different configurations required for both shore and ship systems."
